intro: Leptodermis beichuanensis, commonly known as the Beichuan leptodermis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, greenish flowers that are typically arranged in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
